metadata.title: Replicative Capacity of MERS Coronavirus in Livestock Cell Lines

abstract.original_text: Replicative capacity of Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) was assessed in cell lines derived from livestock and peridomestic small mammals on the Arabian Peninsula. Only cell lines originating from goats and camels showed efficient replication of MERS-CoV. These results provide direction in the search for the intermediate host of MERS-CoV.

sentences.segment_text: Replicative capacity of Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus ( MERS-CoV ) was assessed in cell lines derived from livestock and peridomestic small mammals on the Arabian Peninsula .
Only cell lines originating from goats and camels showed efficient replication of MERS-CoV .
These results provide direction in the search for the intermediate host of MERS-CoV .
